attacks.name: Rock Vengeance
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on all of your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon (1 if there is only 1). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mend
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Fighting Energy card and attach it to Golem. If you do, remove 2 damage counters from Golem.

attacks.name: Enraged Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on Golem to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Tumble Down
attacks.text: Discard as many Fighting Energy cards as you like from your hand. The attack does 30 damage times the number of Fighting Energy cards you discarded.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose up to 3 of them. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Rock Body
abilities.text: All damage done by attacks to Golem is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance.

data.name: Golem

attacks.name: Double Throw
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Megaton Rock
attacks.text: You may do 40 damage instead of 80 to the Defending Pokémon. If you do, during your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Golem by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It sheds its hide once a year. Its boulderlike body is so tough, even dynamite can't harm it.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Golem GL.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Golem E4 does 60 damage to itself.

data.name: Golem

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Golem does 100 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

data.name: Golem

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 3 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: When Golem grow old, they stop shedding their shells. Those that have lived a long, long time have shells green with moss.

data.name: Golem

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Golem does 100 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

data.name: Alolan Golem

attacks.name: Electromagnetic Bomb
attacks.text: Move any number of Lightning Energy from your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage for each Energy card you moved in this way.

attacks.name: Super Zap Cannon
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It's grumpy and stubborn. If you upset it, it discharges electricity from the surface of its body and growls with a voice like thunder.

data.name: Golem

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Explosion
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 100 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.

data.name: Alolan Golem-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Super Electromagnetic Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Heavy Rock-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any cards from their hand during their next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Golem

attacks.name: Electromagnetic Rock Wrecker
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Heavy Slam
attacks.text: This attack does 30 less damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: It fires rocks charged with electricity. Even if the rock isn't fired that accurately, just grazing an opponent will cause numbness and fainting.

attacks.name: Magnitude
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Golem ex does 50 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Crystal Type
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Grass, Fire, or Fighting basic Energy card from your hand to Golem, Golem's type (color) becomes the same as that type of Energy until the end of the turn.

attacks.name: Earth Bomb
attacks.text: Golem does 20 damage to itself. This attack also does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Golem

abilities.name: Desperate Blast
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, put 10 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It detonates its own body. The power from that explosion can propel it up steep mountain paths with amazing speed.

data.name: Golem ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dynamic Roll
attacks.text: During your next turn, attacks used by this Pokémon do 120 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rock Blaster
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Electromagnetic Catapult
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Megaton Fall
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 40 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It fires rocks charged with electricity. Even if the rock isn't fired that accurately, just grazing an opponent will cause numbness and fainting.
